channel.title: Joining clan chat

item.title: Joining clan chat
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Your server probably handles it in ClanChatHandler.java, which is typically in src>server>world on a PI.
You probably cannot make a static reference to the methods in the class, though. So you’ll probably have to use the instance that’s found in your Server class.

Read full topic

item.title: Joining clan chat
item.dc:creator: @AwiesGoesRawr AwiesGoesRawr
item.description:
@AwiesGoesRawr wrote:

Hello!
I want to add this, currently command:

if (playerCommand.startsWith("setcc")) { try { String[] arg = playerCommand.split(" "); String cc = arg[1]; if (arg.length == 2) { c.myCC = cc;

To work while joining the clan chat, so players will join the same clan chat when they next time log in.
I found this from client.java (client.side) which is the one where you type it in.

if(j == 550) { inputTaken = true; inputDialogState = 0; messagePromptRaised = true; promptInput = ""; friendsListAction = 6; aString1121 = "Enter the name of the chat you wish to join"; }

Where does it handle the joining clan chat in server, and how will I add this into it?

Target: Join cc = new setcc, which is stored into player’s charfile.

Read full topic
